Detailed Description

a lexical analyzer for SGML/HTML based on w3c flex sgml lexer

Sgml entities are decomposed in tokens, for example the tag <a href="http..." lang=es> will produce:

SGML_START a (with < and space, etc removed)

SGML_ATTRNAME href (with = removed)

SGML_LITERAL "http..."

SGM_TAGC

Tokens get pushed into a vector, then some instructions call HTML_lexer::process()

Tokens have type of token (an enum), and contents

To process several streams with the same lexer object you can call the base class switch_streams member function. Or set_istream and set_doc

lexer.switch_streams(static_cast<istream*>(&is),NULL); lexer.yylex(); When yylex() is called, the doc that was passed is filled

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

HTML_lexer::HTML_lexer ( const HTML_lexer &  ) [private]
HTML_lexer::HTML_lexer ( std::istream *  in,
std::ostream *  txtout,
const std::string *  base_url = 0,
std::ostream *  lnkout = 0,
std::ostream *  warnings = 0,
Analysis *  analysis = 0,
bool  get_text_if_body_tag_only = true 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in]inistream with the HTML data to parse
[out]txtoutif it's not NULL, textual representation would be written to this stream
[in]base_urlif it's not NULL it should be an absolute url to resolve the relative links of the document to absolute urls
[out]lnkoutif it's not NULL links will be written to this stream, one link per line
[out]warningsif it's not NULL any warnings will be written to this stream
[in]analysisif it's not NULL will be set with meta information about document, such as related feeds, title, etc
get_text_if_body_tag_onlymight be scripts or any bizarre stuff before the body tag, that we don't want. Also if it doesn't contain body it might be garbage
